thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Modified Ball Marker for Golfers (JAK-1049)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Develops Modified Ball Marker for Golfers (JAK-1049) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Modified Ball Marker for Golfers (JAK-1049)
text:
InventHelp, based in Pittsburgh, Pa., is attempting to submit the NEVER 4 GET to companies for their review and potential feedback.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 14, 2015
"I get annoyed when I get on the green and realize that I did not bring a ball marker with me," said an inventor from Fleming Island, Fla. "This inspired me to invent a better ball marker. Now you will never forget to take markers along when you putt."
He developed the patent-pending NEVER 4 GET to offer a convenient way to carry a ball marker. The design ensures that you remember to take a marker along when heading to the green to putt. This saves the user from having to go back to his or her golf bag in order to retrieve a marker, which eliminates hassles and frustrations. The unit provides added peace of mind. Additionally, the marker is designed to be compact and easily portable.
The original design was submitted to the Jacksonville office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-JAK-1049, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
